Literature Review: The role of international oil companies (IOCs) in the net-zero emission energy transition has garnered significant attention in recent years. As the world shifts towards a low-carbon economy, IOCs are leveraging their expertise in hydrocarbon supply chains to drive the rapid scale-up of clean energy technologies. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the current state of the art in IOCs' involvement in the net-zero emission energy transition, with a focus on the production and use of energy carriers such as hydrogen, ammonia, methanol, and synthetic fuels.
